alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hartford and southwestern Hampden Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Britain, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Chicopee, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Westfield, Holyoke, Newington, Windsor, Agawam, West Springfield, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, and Bloomfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
